activities.loc: Branch I, Courthouse Annex, Second Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Walter F. Ducaine Jr.

9:31 AM Defendant Walter F. Ducaine Jr. in court.  Attorney Travis A. Crowell in court for Walter F. Ducaine Jr.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Crowell - plea today, provided form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Crowell agrees.
Court heard on possibility of Life Time Revocation.
Parties agree.
Deft understands.
ADA reads charge in Count 1.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters guilty plea.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Atty Crowell - satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty.
Court dismisses Count 2 outright.
Court order presentence investigation be completed.  Agent to provide report to court at least 14 days prior to sentencing. 
Court schedules w/parties.
Deft remanded into custody of MCSD.

11:44 AM Defendant Walter F. Ducaine in court, in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Walter F. Ducaine appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.

Deft to contact the Public Defenders office today.
